channel.title: Cleaning dead code!
channel.description:
Hey guys, Sibor here. I am a web developer myself. I am certified in HTML/CSS and know the basics of about 6 other web scripting.
If you need help making your CSS files smaller you can talk to me. I remove all the dead. Dead code is what is in the file but doesn't need to be. So just inbox me :D

item.title: Cleaning dead code!
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Or just use http://www.cleancss.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning dead code!
item.dc:creator: @Sibor Sibor
item.description:
@Sibor wrote:

Sorry I forgot about this thread but when I say dead code I am removing the any css elements that aren’t being used thus creating a much cleaner .css files and depending how much I remove can speed up the loading process of the website.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleaning dead code!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:2, topic:456263”][quote author=Sibor link=topic=559201.msg4087635#msg4087635 date=1346020341]
Hey guys, Sibor here. I am a web developer myself. I am certified in HTML/CSS and know the basics of about 6 other web scripting.

If you need help making your CSS files smaller you can talk to me. I remove all the dead. Dead code is what is in the file but doesn’t need to be. So just inbox me
[/quote]
How do you know what is dead code in a CSS file if you don’t know where it’s being utilized?[/quote]

Merely just look through the HTML and see what someone is using. Although, there’s no point whatsoever in this thread, I could train a monkey to do this.

Read full topic
